column2: NJ DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
2. This signal means:
3. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
4. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
5. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column6: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column2: 6. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 8. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 9. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
10. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 11. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 12. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column6: has no effect, they are different substances.
column8: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 13. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 14. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
15. This road sign is:
16. This sign means:
17. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 18. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

column2: 19. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 20. While driving, it is important to slow down:
21. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.

column2: 22. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
23. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.

column2: 24. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 25. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 26. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
27. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 28. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column6: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 29. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 31. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
33. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
35. This sign means:
36. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 37. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 38. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 39. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 40. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column6: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column8: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column10: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed

column2: 42. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 43. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 44. This sign indicates:
column8: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 45. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 46. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
48. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 49. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
50. This road sign means:
